explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 38degC (c.c.) (ICSC (2000)), which is classified into "Category 3." Classified into Class 3 and Packing Group III (UN#2313, Picoline) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified into Class 3 (UN#2313, Picoline) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Class 3 (UN#2313, Picoline) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 400mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 400mg/kg and 800mg/kg (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.29 (2005)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) value of 800mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 800mg/kg and 2,000mg/kg (PATTY (4th, 2000)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the LC50 value of 1,300ppm calculated from the rat LC50 (4 hour inhalation of vapour) value of 5.03mg/L representing the lower of the two testing data of 5.03mg/L and 12.8mg/L (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.29 (2005)) was lower than 90% of the saturated vapour concentration (7,970ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 805Pa (6.05mmHg) (25degC) (CERI Hazard Data 2001-52 (2002)), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of "corrosion" from rabbit skin irritation tests (4 hour application) (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.29 (2005)). Although classified into Category 1A-1C, the substance should be placed in Category 1A from the viewpoint of safety if further subclassification is needed.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Classified as Category 1 in accordance with the technical guideline, given the fact that the substance is classified into Category 1A-1C for "2. Skin corrosion / irritation."

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: "No evidence of skin sensitization" was obtained in guinea pig skin sensitization tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-52 (2002)). However, classification is not possible, with only one set of data showing "negative" available.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in NTP DB (Access on May 2006), CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.29 (2005) and CERI Hazard Data 2001-52 (2002).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible based on expert judgment in the absence of existing classification, though CERI Hazard Data 2001-52 (2002) provides some toxicity data.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (nervous system), Category 3 (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "autonomic disorder such as reduced tension of the vascular smooth muscles, decreased blood pressure and bradycardia, increased pilomotor reflex, impaired thermoregulatory functions, and symptoms of polyneuropathy" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.29 (2005)), "autonomic disorder, bradycardia, hypotension, impaired thermoregulatory functions, mild central nervous system disorder" (PATTY (4th, 2000)), "the substance, in the form of fume, irritates the respiratory tract" (ICSC (J) 1999).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "increased alanine aminotransferase/aspartate aminotransferase activity indicative of hepatotoxicity, and bilirubinemia" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.29 (2005)), "increased activity of hepatic enzymes (SGOT and SGPT) was observed in humans subject to prolonged exposure" (PATTY (4th, 2000)).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 24-72 hours ErC50=15mg/L of the algae (Selenastrum) (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report (preliminary version), 2006).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Harmful to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 3 and the bio-accumulation potential was low (BCF<29(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 3%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 3.
